Mr* William King
December 11, 1956
Our Educational Television Fact Sheet Service is a series of reports, issued
periodically, covering the latest research in the area of educational televi¬
sion, thus keeping our TV members abreast of all developments in such fields
as the use of TV as an instructional tool, the effectiveness of ETV for other
purposes, etc* Other publications are devoted especially to ETV, such as the
detailed reports of the workshops and seminars ndicated above which serve as
valuable reference works on production and engineering* Also, we have several
corralttees working on preparation of TV reports. Mar y of these have already
been published, such as "Compensation of Faculty Members for TV Appearances,"
"Salary Scales of Educational TV Stations", "Student and Staff Training", etc.
Such studies depend for their value on the cooperation of an usefulness to our
TV members, of course*
This past fall we offered a series of small grants to member institutions to
permit them to carry on specific research projects in ETV* Wo also cooperate
with the Institute of Conxnunications Research at the Univarsity of Illinois in
ETV research projects*
I trust that this brief resume of our activities in the television field, and
the publications I am sending you, will satisfactorily demonstrate the value
of membership in our Association. If, after you’ve looked over the materials,
you have any questions, please I t me know, and ve would be happy to consider
your application for membership.
Sincerely,
Harold E. Hill
Associate Director
